title: Labour's internal power struggle is paralysing Britain
text:
The Opposition has the means to postpone an election for a long while yet

I was standing in a damp tent, bored and tired, and there were still three speakers left to go. The shout went up: “What do we want?” “An election!” “When do we want it?” “Now!”

The man leading the chant was Dan Carden, the shadow international development secretary. His audience was a crowd of Momentum activists, gathered in Brighton on the last night of Labour’s conference. It was on the tip of my tongue to point it out, but I resisted: just a couple of weeks before, Labour itself had voted to block the very election Mr Carden was demanding.

But Boris Johnson is having another go. It isn’t so much that conditions are...
description: The Opposition has the means to postpone an election for a long while yet
